result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Fourness

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael A Fourness appeared by video.  Attorney Erica N Young appeared by video for Michael A Fourness.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state. State informed the Court discovery and offer was sent to the previous attorney of record.
Defense requests status date to determine case posture.
Case adjourned to Branch 30. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
ORAL NO CONTACT ORDER: Defendant to have no contact with DAM.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael A Fourness in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 10-18-2022.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
